p: We then focused our analyses on the leg ulcer group. The leg ulcers were present for >12 months in 7 of 17 individuals (41%). The mean leg ulcer area was 6.0 ± 3.4 cm 2 before topical sodium nitrite application and decreased to 3.3 ± 2.7 cm 2 after 4 weeks of applications ( P < .01) (Supplementary Materials). One patient achieved complete closure. No serious adverse events occurred. There were grade 1 adverse events that resolved spontaneously: asymptomatic decrease in diastolic blood pressure below 50 mm Hg, burning, pruritus, and oxygen desaturation to 91%. No patient discontinued the trial because of drug-related toxicities. [ 10]
